body_html:
Thanks for proposing this change. From my reading of issue #3495, it looks like we already have a more general representation for graph collections, in the MetaGraphDef.collection_def field, and a better solution would be to enhance the graph visualizer so that it could accept MetaGraphDef protocol buffers in addition to GraphDef protos. Since a MetaGraphDef includes a GraphDef as one of its fields, this should not be too difficult.

I'm going to close this PR now, but we'd be glad to review a contribution that re-uses the existing tools for representing graph collections in the MetaGraphDef.

From my reading of issue #3495, it looks like we already have a more general representation for graph collections, in the MetaGraphDef.collection_def field, and a better solution would be to enhance the graph visualizer so that it could accept MetaGraphDef protocol buffers in addition to GraphDef protos. Since a MetaGraphDef includes a GraphDef as one of its fields, this should not be too difficult.
I'm going to close this PR now, but we'd be glad to review a contribution that re-uses the existing tools for representing graph collections in the MetaGraphDef.
body:
Thanks for proposing this change. From my reading of issue #3495, it looks like we already have a more general representation for graph collections, in the [`MetaGraphDef.collection_def`](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/7df9c6860e00b91eda0e550b11d9be52d9341d85/tensorflow/core/protobuf/meta_graph.proto#L65) field, and a better solution would be to enhance the graph visualizer so that it could accept `MetaGraphDef` protocol buffers in addition to `GraphDef` protos. Since a `MetaGraphDef` includes a `GraphDef` as one of its fields, this should not be too difficult.

I'm going to close this PR now, but we'd be glad to review a contribution that re-uses the existing tools for representing graph collections in the `MetaGraphDef`.
